description: (154 Magazine St.), 1BR, 1100, Hello. I'm subletting my room for the summer.Dates available: The room is available May 1 through July 31. The rent is $1100/ month and includes internet and utilities. We have a washer and dryer in our apartment that will be available to you. There is the possible option of renewing the lease beginning in Aug. The room can be furnished or unfurnished,  depending on your preference.Apartment: I'm renting out one bedroom in a four bedroom apartment. We have two bathrooms so you will share a bathroom with one other person. The spacious room is downstairs in our two story apartment. There is a window but it also half underground so it is cooler like a basement but still bright enough that you don't feel like you're in a cave. The common space is upstairs includes a bright sunny common room and a fully stocked kitchen. The roommates are grad students in their mid to late 20s. Everyone is easy going and we all keep things in common spaces tidy.Location: The apartment is conveniently located in Cambridgeport. We are across the street from Trader Joes and just around the corner from Whole Foods. There is plenty to do within walking distance and there is easy access to downtown. We are a 12 min walk from Central square where you can catch the red line. The green line is a 12 min. walk in the other direction. Bus 47 picks up across the street.The MIT campus begins about a half mile away. The Harvard campus begins about a mile in the other direction. Boston University is a 10 min walk across the Charles River.There is also a safe running/bike path around the Charles which beings about .2 of a mile away. There are always people out running and biking and it is well lit and great for evening stroll or workout.Bike: There is indoor parking for your bike,  if you choose to bring one.I will remove this post when we've found someone so if you see this,  the room is still available.Pictures are available upon request.
heading: Summer Sublet- Great location between Harvard,  MIT,  and Boston Univ

With 24/7 doorman,  concierge and on-site maintenance services you can rest assure your needs will be met and your safety is top priority. description: $900 (South Boston), 5BR, 900, Hello, I'm looking for a replacement for a townhouse in South Boston. There are 5 of us living there now and I'll be moving out at the end of the month so moving in for March would be preferred but April would be acceptable as well (or anywhere during the month of March). The setup for the available room(s) is a bit strange in that it is actually two smaller rooms,  each approximately 8'x10' on the third floor across the hall from one another.The house is a block away from Local 149 and a liquor store as well as a couple blocks from the beach and right by castle island with easy access to the 5,  7,  9,  10,  and 11 buses. All the guys are young professionals working in the Seaport and Downtown,  ranging from ages 23-28. All are laid back,  we like drinking and having a good time,  in moderation. This is not a frat house and we don't treat it like one. We only have one bathroom,  which sounds like it might be an issue but has never really been a problem as all of our schedules are pretty staggered in the morning and we're,  you know,  dudes.Our mentality has been keep your room however messy you want it but the common areas are kept pretty clean and neat.If the room and place sound interesting,  then feel free to email and we can figure out a time you can check the place out and meet some of the current roommates (obviously they'd like to meet and make sure you vibe well together before moving in).Utilities included,  except for cable/internet,  which will be $20 a month. Coin-op laundry in the basement. The room is not furnishedNo couples and no pets.Thanks

description: . Spacious and Modern (South End), 2BR, 3400, ID: 1081527Location: Massachusetts,  Boston (South End)Rent: $3400 / MonthBroker Fee: One MonthAvailable Date: NOWBeds: 2Baths: 2Pet: No PetFeatures: A/C,  Alcove,  Balcony,  Central Air,  Ceramic Tiles,  Deck,  Dining Room,  Dishwasher,  Disposal,  Eat-in Kitchen,  Fireplace (Decorative),  Granite Counter Tops,  Hardwood Floors,  High Ceiling,  Laundry in Unit,  Microwave,  Modern Bath,  Modern Kitchen,  New Appliances,  New/Renovated Bath,  New/Renovated Kitchen,  Parking For Rent,  Private Roof Deck,  Roof Deck,  Stainless Steel Appliance(s),  Storage,  Walk-In ClosetThis large two bedroom,  one bathroom apartment will be fully renovated with granite countertops,  stainless appliances and a double vanity,  and new tile bathroom. The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit. There is a large private roof deck in the rear which is dedicated solely to this apartment. A beautiful mature oak reaching up from the ground level provides a nice shade in the summer months. This historic preservation balances modern technology with historic preservation. The soaring twelve foot ceilings coupled with the two highly ornate mantles (non-functional),  the plaster crown molding and the flying scrolls provide an uncompromised traditional ambiance. This apartment is the epitome of modern living in a highly ornate historic preservation.Building constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  and has undergone a complete historic preservation conversion. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating system,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. Efficient insulation has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.Located near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. The property is close to several transportation options and there are five Zip Car stations about ¼ mile away,  7 bus lines pass near the property,  and there are two Hub Way Bike stations nearby.The hospital is two blocks away. Downtown and several universities are in the direct vicinity. The building is also located less than ½ mile from the on ramp to I-93 allowing for easy access to regional commuting.Subway Lines and Stops:SILVER - Newton St. (0.37 miles)Bus Routes and Stops:47 - Albany St Opp E Newton St (0.1 miles)10 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)CT3 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)8 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)CT1 - 88 E Newton St (0.18 miles)16 - South Bay Mall & Office Max (0.55 miles)Garvens Florusshow contact infoBoston Green Realty LLCprices,  conditions and rental terms are subject to change at any time.
